{{Use mdy dates|date=April 2014}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Seth Walker | image = | caption = | image_size = | background = solo_singer | birth_name = | alias = | birth_date = {{birth year and age|1974}} | birth_place = [[North Carolina]], United States | death_date = | death_place = | instrument = Guitar, vocals | genre = [[Electric blues]], [[Americana (music)|Americana]], [[jazz]] | occupation = Musician, songwriter | years_active = 1990s-present | label = Various | associated_acts = | website = {{URL|http://www.sethwalker.com/welcome/|Official website}} | notable_instruments = }} '''Seth Walker''' (born 1974) is an American electric blues singer, guitarist, and songwriter. He has released seven albums to date.{{cite web|author=Steve Leggett |url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/seth-walker-mn0000732799/biography |title=Seth Walker | Biography |publisher=AllMusic |date= |accessdate=March 24, 2014}} Walker's musical genres include [[Americana (music)|Americana]] and [[jazz]].{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.thealternateroot.com/in-their-own-words/194-on-the-record/1106-seth-walker-stacy-jefress-interview |title=Seth Walker – Interview of the Week |publisher=Thealternateroot.com |date= |accessdate=March 24, 2014}} His 2009 album, ''Leap of Faith'' peaked at number 2 in the US ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Billboard charts|Top Blues Album]] [[record chart|chart]]. [[Delbert McClinton]] remarked "the first time I heard Seth Walker at a small club in Nashville I was impressed like I haven't been impressed in 30 years, with performance, presence, and great songs."{{cite web|url=http://sethwalker.com/3.0/bio/ |title=Bio : Seth Walker |publisher=Sethwalker.com |date= |accessdate=March 24, 2014}} ==Life and career== Walker was born in [[North Carolina]], United States to classically trained musical parents. He learned to play the cello by the age of five, and gravitated towards the blues in his teenage years, largely inspired by the work of [[B.B. King]], [[Snooks Eaglin]], [[Ray Charles]] and [[T-Bone Walker]].{{cite web|url=http://www.last.fm/music/Seth+Walker/+wiki |title=Seth Walker's Biography |publisher=Last.fm |date=November 26, 2013 |accessdate=March 24, 2014}} Walker attended [[East Carolina University]] where he studied art. His first public performance occurred in [[Greenville, South Carolina]], where Walker opened with his [[cover version]] of [[Stevie Ray Vaughan]]'s, "Cold Shot". He left Carolina and lived in [[Jacksonville, Florida]], for a short time. In his early twenties Walker moved to [[Austin, Texas]], and began to develop his skills as a singer, songwriter and guitarist. His first album, ''When It Pours It Rains'' was released in 1998. ''Meet Me in the Middle'' (2000) was similarly credited to the Seth Walker Band.{{cite web|url=http://www.amazon.com/Meet-Me-In-The-Middle/dp/B00005JY6G |title=Meet Me in the Middle |publisher=Amazon.com |date= |accessdate=March 24, 2014}} His 2002 album release was entitled ''Restless''.{{cite web|url=http://www.amazon.com/Restless-Seth-Walker/dp/B00006ANGD |title=Restless |publisher=Amazon.com |date=June 26, 2002 |accessdate=March 24, 2014}} ''On the Outside'' (2005) followed with a billing crediting Seth Walker and the Differentials, with his self-titled album appearing in 2006. ''Seth Walker'' received critical acclaim from periodicals including ''[[No Depression (magazine)|No Depression]]'', ''Blues Revue'' and ''Maverick UK''. Walker met the [[Grammy Award]] winning [[Gary Nicholson]], with whom he developed a songwriting partnership. This alliance led to his most successful release to date, ''Leap of Faith'' (2009), which was produced by Nicholson. Walker stated "this album was made during a time in my life when I was caught up in some shadows. The idea of a leap of faith actually does reflect where I was at personally and making this record was the light for me."{{cite web|url=http://www.artistexclusive.com/sethwalker.html |title=Seth Walker |publisher=Artist Exclusive |date= |accessdate=March 24, 2014}} The album contained tracks written by Walker alone, Walker and Nicholson, plus work by other songwriters including [[Nick Lowe]] and [[Percy Mayfield]].{{cite web|url=http://www.stlblues.net/slim_sethwalker_leapoffaith.htm |title=STLBlues Reviews :: Seth Walker – Leap of Faith |publisher=Stlblues.net |date= |accessdate=March 24, 2014}} Walker performed at the [[Austin City Limits Music Festival]] in September 2011, and has toured supporting both [[Raul Malo]] and [[The Wood Brothers]]. The song "Back in Your Arms Again", jointly penned by Malo, Nicholson, and Walker, was recorded for [[The Mavericks]]' 2013 album, ''[[In Time (album)|In Time]]'', and released by them as a single. Walker lived for fifteen years in Austin, before he relocated again in 2009 to [[Nashville, Tennessee]],{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.annarbor.com/entertainment/seth-walker/ |title=Seth Walker's rootsy musical mix coming to The Ark |publisher=Annarbor.com |date=August 5, 2013 |accessdate=March 24, 2014}} where he recorded ''Time Can Change'' (2012). In November that year, Walker shifted to [[New Orleans]] and started work on a [[Extended play|EP]]. In August 2013, he planned to release three such EPs, each in a different musical genre, and in various roles utilising Raul Malo, Oliver Wood (from the Wood Brothers) and [[John Porter (musician)|John Porter]]. ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2"| Album details ! colspan="4"| Peak chart positions ! rowspan="2"| Credit(s) |- ! style="width:3em;font-size:75%;"| [[Billboard 200|US Billboard 200]]
